links.label: The Golden Age of Radio: Program 82 - January, 1977 - Staats Cottsworth
American Studies at the Univ. of Virginia : A Day in Radio (September 21, 1939)

infos.info: (1) At some point in 1941 the time slot changed from 11:30 a.m. to 12:15 p.m., where it remained until June 21, 1946; - (2) Richard Leibert was the organist and William Meeder the musical director - (3) Sound effects were by Bill Brown, Lavern Owens and Walt McDonough - (4) The program was produced by the Ruthrauff and Ryan Advertising Agency - (5) The soap opera ' Bright Horizon' - (6) Sponsors included Ivory Soap, Spic and Span and Rinso - (7) Ann Sheperd (Scheindel Kalish) - (8) Radio's Golden Years and The Big Broadcast report the broadcast history to include 1936 (CBS)
